headline: Colgate-Palmolive’s Q2 Earnings Call: Our Top 5 Analyst Questions
summary: Colgate-Palmolive’s second quarter results were characterized by modest year-on-year growth, as the company navigated a challenging operating environment marked by persistent raw material inflation and category volatility. Management attributed the quarter’s performance to improved revenue growth management, resilient performance in core brands, and innovation across product categories. headline: CL Q2 Deep Dive: Modest Growth Amid Cost Pressures and Strategic Shifts
summary: Consumer products company Colgate-Palmolive (NYSE:CL) reported revenue ahead of Wall Street’s expectations in Q2 CY2025, with sales up 1% year on year to $5.11 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.92 per share was 2.8% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
